data.title: Duration property for MediaPlayer and Song
data.body:
- Added Duration for MediaPlayer (current playing song) - WinRT
- Implemented Duration for Song (only works when playing the song) - WinRT

data.title: Implement audio conversion
data.body:
Use NAudio 1.7 (currently in pre-release) on Windows as this provides all the decoding and encoding we need via the MediaFoundation APIs.

Use CoreAudio on Mac OS X.

Will have to investigate options for Linux.

data.title: Implement ReflectiveWriter
data.body: As a fallback if there are no specific content type writers for the given object, the pipeline uses Reflection to write the object with a ReflectiveWriter (the counterpart to ReflectiveReader).

data.title: Implement Texture Importer/Processor/Writer
data.body:
Implement the TextureImporter, TextureProcessor, texture writers, and associated content classes:

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.content.pipeline.textureimporter.aspx
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.content.pipeline.processors.textureprocessor.aspx

The texture writers are internal classes and not publicly documented.  This means we don't have to follow anything but just derive from ContentTypeWriter<T> for 2D, 3D, and Cube texture content.  The file format should match what MonoGame TextureReader expects and stick to stock for Windows/Xbox/WP7, but we can make changes as we need for other platforms.

data.title: WindowsPhoneGamePlatform.Exit() Unimplemneted
data.body:
I'm trying to call `WindowsPhoneGamePlatform.Exit()` so that I can switch to another Xaml page (for menus etc), then re-launch `GamePage.xaml` to start the game from the beginning again. Calling `Exit()` from within my game gives me a `NotImplementedException` (see Line 164 in WPGamePlatform.cs).

I tried adding various calls to Dispose() and Game.SuppressDraw() but kept getting different errors. I'm not sure how to cancel / stop the Game loop. What code should be in this Exit() method?

data.title: MonoDevelop Content Pipeline AddIn

milestone.title: Content Pipleline Release
milestone.description: This milestone will be used to track Content Pipeline related issues. It has no release date as yet.

data.body:
With the new Content Builder work in progress we need to start thinking about how this will be integrated into MonoDevelop so that developers on Mac, Linux and Windows can compile content easily. 

Depending on how this goes we might not go down the route of having a separate content project, it should be possible to add resources to the project directly and flag them so they will be compiled by the content builder. 

There might be scope for a separate content project as well.

At the moment the plan is to add a new File action of "MonoGameContent" which can be selected for any type of file, add addition file properties to allow the ContentImporter and Content Processor to be set within the application.
We can then hook into the build process to pickup the special content at build time and place the resultant .xnb files in appropriate output directory (preserving the directory structure within the solution, so 

Content/Effects/MyEffect.fx 

would end up as 

bin/$Configuration/Content/Effects/MyEffect.xnb

We can make use of the MonoGamePlatform which is already present in most of the project templates to make sure we compile content for a specific platform. These properties need to be added to the iOS and Android projects somehow.

We will also need a way to specify in the IDE where the content builder is installed and
some way of allowing the developer to set a list of directories which can be used to resolve content processors and importers, this information can be written out to the content builder. This might be at the IDE level or at the project level, but more likely at the IDE level to start with.

We also need a way to populate a dropdown list of Processors and Importers so they can be easily selected. There can be defaults which will be used for known types so a .png when flagged as a MonoGameContent item will automatically get a Importer of TextureImporter and a processor of TextureProcessor.

data.title: Add Command File To MGCB Tool

milestone.title: Content Pipleline Release
milestone.description: This milestone will be used to track Content Pipeline related issues. It has no release date as yet.

data.body:
The new MonoGame Content Builder command line tool...

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/tree/develop3d/Tools/MGCB

Currently tries to parse .contentproj files to find importers and content to build.  This fails to work in all cases as 
- We currently depend on MSBuild API to parse the .content project which won't work for non-MS platforms.
- If a content project uses wildcards we have to evaluate the content project... another MSBuild dependency.
- The importers/processors might be part of a referenced project that hasn't been built.

The MGCB should really only be responsible for building content...  not to build or find dependent assemblies.  

With that in mind what we need an alternative to .contentproj to feed the assemblies and content building instructions to the command line tool.  This is where a command file would come in.

The command file should be plain text formatted and easily constructed from an MSBuild .target file (i think this means it cannot be XML or JSON).  It should contain:
- List of all assemblies which should be scanned for importers, processors, writers.
- List of content files to process.
- The properties which define how to build each content file.

This command file would then be passed to MGCB and it would execute it to complete the content build.

data.title: Implement FontDescriptionImporter and FontDescriptionProcessor
data.body:
Implement the FontDescriptionImporter and FontDescriptionProcessor related content classes to match functionality of MS XNA.

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.content.pipeline.fontdescriptionimporter.aspx

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.content.pipeline.processors.fontdescriptionprocessor.aspx

We should correct some wrongs like assumption of DXT compression (we want PVRTC on iOS for example).

data.title: Implement FBXImporter
data.body:
Implement the functional equivalent to the FBXImporter content pipeline class:

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.content.pipeline.fbximporter.aspx

It should be written to be compatible with the MS stock one to begin with, but we should eventually expose more of the data in the FBX...  cameras, lights, etc.

Consider using this existing managed wrapper for the Autodesk FBX SDK:

https://github.com/returnString/ManagedFBX

data.body: Will be developed3d merged back to master?

data.title: SetValue not implemented for boolean effect parameters
data.body:
Effect.Parameters["SomeBoolParam"].SetValue(true) throws a NotImplementedException.

Pretty standard stuff, just calling it out in hopes that tracking helps resolve it sooner :)

data.title: DrawUserIndexPrimitives with int indices array parameter does not work, but it does with short.
data.body:
Basically, the code provided in this (http://www.riemers.net/eng/Tutorials/XNA/Csharp/Series1/Terrain_basics.php) tutorial does not produce the expected result. The culprit seems to be the particular overload of DrawUserIndexPrimitives.

Using an indices array of type int[] does not produce the expected result shown on the page.

Converting the indices array to type short[] fixes the problem.

All the code is provided in the linked page.

As an added bit of info, I am running on a 64-bit Windows 8 platform running the latest stable 3.0 (1/21/2013)

data.title: Fix XACT loop loading
data.body:
For simple sounds (0x02) we don't come across any problems, but for looped/complex sounds (0x03, in our case) the parser will explode when this offset value is wrong.

This aligns properly both for simple sounds (typically the data length is 7, 5 bytes between the extradatalen value and the next sound's flag) and complex sounds (read: it doesn't crash anymore for complex audio). Basically, this extradatalen probably includes the length of the extradatalen value itself.

Test cases appreciated, both functioning and non-functioning.

data.title: New Windows Desktop DX11 Platform [TEST ME!]
data.body:
This pull contains a new Windows desktop platform which uses DirectX 11 and associated systems.  This is an alternative to the Windows desktop OpenGL platform.
- Renamed Windows platform to WindowsGL.
- Added new Windows platform targeting DX11.
- Added ResourceCreatedEventArgs and ResourceDestroyedEventArgs.
- Added conditionals for DIRECTX11_1, WINDOWS_MEDIA_ENGINE, and WINDOWS_MEDIA_SESSION.

This platform doesn't have working audio yet... will get to that tomorrow.

I've tested these changes on all the Windows platforms.  It could use testing on Mac, iOS, Android, and Linux.

data.title: [Pipeline] First XNB file has been written
data.body:
Enough the content pipeline has now been implemented to do simple import, process and write.  More importers, processors and type writers need to be written.

This PR includes the mgcb branch by @tomspilman. The PipelineManager from that branch was used for the test, and this PR contains a small change to the PipelineManager in how it finds built-in types.

data.title: Getting above 60 FPS
Fix for Issue #669 + Improved Window Management for Desktop Platforms
data.body:
_Apologies for cluttering the pull request stack, still working out how to use this_

Ok, finally got round to cleaning up my patch.

This addresses Issue #669 and has been fully tested on my Windows machine. I've also got access to Linux for testing which I'll do ASAP.

If there are too many unnecessary changes, let me know - I also did a little refactoring as I went a long and that could be reverted to make the logical differences more clear.

On Windows, the behaviour outlined at MSDN for user resizing (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb203876(v=xnagamestudio.40).aspx) now works as expected. In addition, a user may programatically change the window size by setting the GraphicsDeviceManager PreferredBackBufferWidth/Height and calling ApplyChanges() as is the behaviour in XNA.

There's a lot of new stuff in this patch so it definitely needs to be tested thoroughly before merging.

data.title: General re-write of window handling for Desktop platforms.
data.body:
Ok, finally got round to cleaning up my patch. 

This addresses Issue #669 and has been fully tested on my Windows machine. I've also got access to Linux for testing which I'll do ASAP. 

If there are too many unnecessary changes, let me know - I also did a little refactoring as I went a long and that could be reverted to make the logical differences more clear. 

On Windows, the behaviour outlined at MSDN for user resizing (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb203876(v=xnagamestudio.40).aspx) now works as expected. In addition, a user may programatically change the window size by setting the GraphicsDeviceManager PreferredBackBufferWidth/Height and calling ApplyChanges() as is the behaviour in XNA. 

There's a lot of new stuff in this patch so it definitely needs to be tested thoroughly before merging.

data.title: GraphicsDeviceManager.ApplyChanges() on OSX exits (no crash/exception thrown)
data.body:
On OSX I can set the resolution properly when we initialize the Game, but whenever we attempt to change the display settings (or I guess, just calling ApplyChanges()) the application will exit immediately.

I'd try to give a backtrace, but oddly the game exits gracefully without any error output.

I looked into the method in the source, and I'm not even sure where it even changes the settings. It's pretty clear where we initialize the NSWindow, but what about changing it in-game?

data.title: Windows 8: Touches are not removed, when releasing the finger above a xaml control
data.body:
Hi guys,

I have noticed the following behavior: 
When using Xaml Controls on top of a SwapChainBackgroundPanel the TouchCollection will not clear touches, if you: 
- Start Pressing on the SwapChainBackgroundPanel  
- Move into Xaml Control 
- Release the Touch 

A call to TouchPanel.GetState() will still return those touches, even if no fingers are down. 

Steps to reproduce:
- new xaml monogame project
- create a Xaml Button in GamePage.xaml
- run it
- Start Start touching outside the Button
- Move into Button
- Release the touch
- Place a Breakpoint in Game1.Update
- check in Immediate Window: TouchPanel.GetState().Count
- see that the touch is still there

Reason: 
in Windows8/InputEvents.cs 
the inputElement.PointerReleased Event does not fire. 

Fix that worked for me: 
Use inputElement.PointerExited instead

Best and thx for the great work
Till

data.title: SpriteBatch.End() throws OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsErrorException: InvalidEnum
data.body:
Hi guys.
I originally posted this post here : http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14268379/spritebatch-end-throws-opentk-graphics-graphicserrorexception-invalidenum

I decided to begin game development with MonoGame but I am facing a problem.

When I try to add a sprite to the screen with a SpriteBatch object like I can read in many XNA tutorial, I get an OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsErrorException.

```
protected override void Draw (GameTime gameTime)
{
    graphics.GraphicsDevice.Clear (Color.CornflowerBlue);

    spriteBatch.Begin();
    spriteBatch.Draw(spriteTexture, position, Color.White);
    spriteBatch.End(); // <ââ Exception here

    base.Draw (gameTime);
}
```

Exception.Message says InvalidEnum.

```
OpenTK.Graphics.GraphicsErrorException: InvalidEnum
  at OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ErrorHelper.CheckErrors () [0x000c0] in /home/sam/TÃ©lÃ©chargements/opentk/src/opentk/Source/OpenTK/Graphics/OpenGL/ErrorHelper.cs:118
  at OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.ErrorHelper.Dispose () [0x00000] in /home/sam/TÃ©lÃ©chargements/opentk/src/opentk/Source/OpenTK/Graphics/OpenGL/ErrorHelper.cs:129
  at OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.TexEnv (TextureEnvTarget target, TextureEnvParameter pname, Int32 param) [0x0001e] in /home/sam/TÃ©lÃ©chargements/opentk/src/opentk/Source/OpenTK/Graphics/OpenGL/GL.cs:69308
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch.End () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at FirstGame.Game1.Draw (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime gameTime) [0x0003c] in /home/sam/Developpement/C#/Test/FirstGame/Game1.cs:82
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.DoDraw (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime gameTime) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameWindow.OnRenderFrame (System.Object sender, OpenTK.FrameEventArgs e) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenTK.GameWindow.OnRenderFrame (OpenTK.FrameEventArgs e) [0x0000b] in /home/sam/TÃ©lÃ©chargements/opentk/src/opentk/Source/OpenTK/GameWindow.cs:976
  at OpenTK.GameWindow.OnRenderFrameInternal (OpenTK.FrameEventArgs e) [0x00016] in /home/sam/TÃ©lÃ©chargements/opentk/src/opentk/Source/OpenTK/GameWindow.cs:1032
  at OpenTK.GameWindow.RaiseRenderFrame (System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch render_watch, System.Double& next_render, OpenTK.FrameEventArgs render_args) [0x00104] in /home/sam/TÃ©lÃ©chargements/opentk/src/opentk/Source/OpenTK/GameWindow.cs:527
  at OpenTK.GameWindow.DispatchUpdateAndRenderFrame (System.Object sender, System.EventArgs e) [0x00018] in /home/sam/TÃ©lÃ©chargements/opentk/src/opentk/Source/OpenTK/GameWindow.cs:433
  at OpenTK.GameWindow.Run (Double updates_per_second, Double frames_per_second) [0x000d5] in /home/sam/TÃ©lÃ©chargements/opentk/src/opentk/Source/OpenTK/GameWindow.cs:411
  at OpenTK.GameWindow.Run (Double updateRate) [0x00000] in /home/sam/TÃ©lÃ©chargements/opentk/src/opentk/Source/OpenTK/GameWindow.cs:358
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameWindow.Run (Double updateRate) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.LinuxGamePlatform.RunLoop () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Run (GameRunBehavior runBehavior) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Run () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at FirstGame.Program.Main () [0x0000a] in /home/sam/Developpement/C#/Test/FirstGame/Program.cs:21
```

Like it's very basic stuff I don't know if I am not missing something â¦

I am using MonoGame version 2.5.10 from MonoDevelop under an ArchLinux installation up to date. Mono version is 2.10.8 and OpenTK version is the latest stable release (2010.10.06).

Everything work fine with Windows 7.

Hope someone can help me with this issue !

data.title: Fix single sided stencil
data.body:
When not using TwoSidedStencilMode the same settings must apply to both
FrontFace and BackFace.

This fixed a transition that creates a stencil mask and happened to be
CounterClockWise. Results are now similar to XNA.

data.title: This makes use of the offsetInBytes parameter in SetData
data.body: Make use of the offsetInBytes parameter to SetData and preserve memory allocated for the GPU instead of discarding memory allocations with each draw pass. This PR is from Gena Minchuk.

data.title: Update submodules to point to latest head
data.body: Samples and ThirdParty/Libs submodules required updating to latest.
